p: Botanically, fleagrass is an aromatic perennial herb with an erect stem and many branches that can grow to a height of 40–45 cm. The stems are angulate, bearing paired leaves, each of which is 1.2 × 2 cm in size and ovate-oblong in shape. The purple flowers form terminal spikes that bloom from October to November. The fruit is an oblong capsule that dehisces into four straw-coloured lobes when mature. The fruiting spike can be as long as 5 cm. The numerous minute ovate seeds mature in December (Fig. 1).
